0.Pros: Amazing benefits: 3 weeks paid vacation, no cost health insurance, matching 401k. Owners are nice to work for. I make my own schedule.
0.Cons: Constantly being on call 24 hours a day. Working all weekends and holidays. Not enough help. Hardly get anyone that applies.

1.Pros: the best part of working at Mcdonalds was working as a team and making friends
1.Cons: no room for improvement. It is very hard to move up within the company

2.Pros: It felt really rewarding to learn new positions, and to teach others new skills as a Crew Trainer. Some of the customers could be so kind and fun to talk with. I made some of my best friends working at McDonalds.
2.Cons: I worked at a franchise, so a lot of this may vary place to place. I was promised promotions so often and had them swept out from under me by people less qualified. It took MONTHS to get a pay raise once I finally did get promoted, as well as the raise that came with working overnight. As is the case with most customer service job, there were a lot of threats against my crew and I for MINOR mistakes. Rude customers, things thrown at me, people demanding free food while drunk.

3.Cons: long hours, late hours, some coworkers...

5.Pros: - flexible hours- easy job- steady wage

7.Pros: It if pretty fun to work at my mcdonalds at 21st and Greenwich, the GM is a super chill guy who you can talk to and make friends with.
7.Cons: The Management in the restaurant is pretty lacking and they is fighting in the kitchen that holds up the orders

8.Pros: Fast Pace, learned how to manage time effectively.
8.Cons: Pay was not worth the amount of work.

9.Cons: You're working at McDonalds, so that's a con.
